channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: 9 years to 2032 Olympics
item.description:
Sunday, July 23, 2023

City Hall will be lit Green and Yellow to celebrate 9 years to 2032 Olympics.

23 July 2023 marks 9 years to the start Brisbane 2032 Olympic games. The Brisbane 2032 Olympic Games will create a legacy, which aligns with Council’s commitment to making the Brisbane of tomorrow even better than the Brisbane of today.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Green and Yellow to celebrate 9 years to 2032 Olympics.
23 July 2023 marks 9 years to the start Brisbane 2032 Olympic games. The Brisbane 2032 Olympic Games will create a legacy, which aligns with Council’s commitment to making the Brisbane of tomorrow even better than the Brisbane of today.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate

item.title: Donate Life Week
item.description:
Sunday, July 23, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Magenta to support Donate Life Week.

DonateLife Queensland aims to save the lives of the 1800 Australians on the transplant waitlist by coordinating organ and tissue retrieval throughout Queensland hospitals. The annual national DonateLife Week campaign raises awareness on the need to register as an organ and tissue donor on the Australian Organ Donor Register.

This Light Up is organised by: DonateLife Queensland

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: International AIDS Society and HIV Science
item.description:
Monday, July 24, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support International Aids Society and HIV Science.

International AIDS Society convenes, educates and advocates for a world in which HIV no longer presents a threat to public health and individual well-being.

The IAS 2023, being held at the Brisbane Convention and Exhibition Centre, will shine a spotlight on the world's advances in HIV research, and is the world’s most influential meeting on HIV research and its applications. This biennial conference presents the critical advances in basic, clinical and operational HIV research that move science into policy and practice. Through its open and inclusive programme, the meeting sets the gold standard of HIV science, featuring highly diverse and cutting-edge research.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: World Drowning Prevention Day
item.description:
Tuesday, July 25, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support World Drowning Prevention Day.

World Drowning Prevention Day invites stakeholders – irrespective of the sector they represent – to take one concrete action to advance drowning prevention, something all of us can do – at any level and at any time. This year's theme is "Do one thing to prevent drowning” and will help Royal Life Saving achieve it's objectives.
Royal Life Saving Queensland is focused on reducing drowning and promoting healthy, active and skilled communities through innovative, reliable, evidence based advocacy.

This Light Up is organised by: Royal Life Saving Society Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support World Drowning Prevention Day.

This year's theme is "Do one thing to prevent drowning” and will help Royal Life Saving achieve it's objectives. Royal Life Saving Queensland is focused on reducing drowning and promoting healthy, active and skilled communities through innovative, reliable, evidence based advocacy.
This Light Up is organised by: Royal Life Saving Society Queensland
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 1 year to Paris 2024 Olympics
item.description:
Wednesday, July 26, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to celebrate 1 year to Paris 2024 Olympics.

One year from today Paris 2024 will host the XXXIII Olympic Summer Games, 26 July to 11 August.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup
item.description:
Thursday, July 27, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit all colours to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup.

From 20 July to 20 August, Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia will co-host the FIFA Women’s World Cup. This will be the first time that the tournament will be co-hosted across two countries and Brisbane/Meaajin is proud to be one of the nine Host Cities.

As well as hosting matches, a Fan Festival™ in Brisbane/Meaanjin will take place at the South Bank Parklands, offering the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.  

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate
item.xCal:description: Sandgate Town Hall will be lit all colours to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup. From 20 July to 20 August, Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia will co-host the FIFA Women’s World Cup. This will be the first time that the tournament will be co-hosted across two countries and Brisbane/Meaajin is proud to be one of the nine Host Cities. As well as hosting matches, a Fan Festival™ in Brisbane/Meaanjin will take place at the South Bank Parklands, offering the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.   Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™ This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup – Australia vs Nigeria
item.description:
Thursday, July 27, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink, Green, White, Orange, Light Blue and Yellow, alternating with Green and Gold to celebrate Australia playing Nigeria in the FIFA Women's World Cup.

Tonight we cheer on the Australian Matildas as they play their second match of the FIFA women’s World Cup here at Brisbane Stadium. If you can’t get to the game, head to the Fan Festival™ at the South Bank Parklands - the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 202nd Independence Day of Peru
item.description:
Friday, July 28, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red and White to recognise the 202nd Independence Day of Peru.

July 28 marks the 202nd Independence Day of Peru. The Honorary Consulate of Peru aims to bring Peruvian residents in Brisbane and Gold Coast together and share their culture with the Australian community.

This Light Up is organised by: Consul of Peru

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red and White to recognise the 202nd Independence Day of Peru.

This Light Up is organised by: Consul of Peru

item.title: Strive To Be Kind Day
item.description:
Friday, July 28, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Yellow to support Strive To Be Kind Day.

The Allison Baden-Clay Foundation aims to reduce the incidents of family and domestic violence through education programs in the community, schools and corporates. The Foundation was established following the murder of Allison in 2012, and Strive To Be Kind Day brings about awareness and raises funds for the elimination of domestic abuse and coercive control. It also celebrates Allison's life as her family and friends share the Strive To Be Kind Day lunch in Brisbane each year. The state is encouraged to wear yellow, buy a sunflower and perform a random act of kindness.

This Light Up is organised by: Allison Baden Clay Foundation

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate
item.xCal:description:
Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Yellow to support Strive To Be Kind Day.

The Foundation was established following the murder of Allison in 2012, and Strive To Be Kind Day brings about awareness and raises funds for the elimination of domestic abuse and coercive control. It also celebrates Allison's life as her family and friends share the Strive To Be Kind Day lunch in Brisbane each year. The state is encouraged to wear yellow, buy a sunflower and perform a random act of kindness.
This Light Up is organised by: Allison Baden Clay Foundation

City Hall will be lit Yellow to support Strive To Be Kind Day.

The Allison Baden-Clay Foundation aims to reduce the incidents of family and domestic violence through education programs in the community, schools and corporates. The Foundation was established following the murder of Allison in 2012, and Strive To Be Kind Day brings about awareness and raises funds for the elimination of domestic abuse and coercive control. It also celebrates Allison's life as her family and friends share the Strive To Be Kind Day lunch in Brisbane each year. The state is encouraged to wear yellow, buy a sunflower and perform a random act of kindness.

This Light Up is organised by: Allison Baden Clay Foundation 

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup
item.description:
Saturday, July 29, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit all colours to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup.

From 20 July to 20 August, Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia will co-host the FIFA Women’s World Cup. This will be the first time that the tournament will be co-hosted across two countries and Brisbane/Meaajin is proud to be one of the nine Host Cities.

As well as hosting matches, a Fan Festival™ in Brisbane/Meaanjin will take place at the South Bank Parklands, offering the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.  

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Small Steps 4 Hannah Gala
item.description:
Saturday, July 29, 2023

City Hall will be lit Pink to celebrate the Small Steps 4 Hannah Gala taking place in City Hall.

Small Steps 4 Hannah Gala In their quest to honour Hannah, Aaliyah, Laianah and Trey and ensure that no family should endure this pain again, the Clarke family have started a movement for change ‘Small Steps 4 Hannah’ to put a HALT to the incidences and severity of domestic and family violence in Australia.

Our Gala Ball is to fundraise to support the rollout of our new Educational Program "HALT" Program in the schools. This is to teach healthy and respectful relationships for all children at a young age. We also give funds to smaller grass roots DFV charities who do not receive Government Funding.

This Light Up is organised by: Small Steps 4 Hannah



Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description: City Hall will be lit Pink to celebrate the Small Steps 4 Hannah Gala taking place in City Hall. Small Steps 4 Hannah Gala In their quest to honour Hannah, Aaliyah, Laianah and Trey and ensure that no family should endure this pain again, the Clarke family have started a movement for change ‘Small Steps 4 Hannah’ to put a HALT to the incidences and severity of domestic and family violence in Australia. Our Gala Ball is to fundraise to support the rollout of our new Educational Program "HALT" Program in the schools. This is to teach healthy and respectful relationships for all children at a young age. We also give funds to smaller grass roots DFV charities who do not receive Government Funding. This Light Up is organised by: Small Steps 4 Hannah
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 World Hepatitis Day
item.description:
Sunday, July 30, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Green to support 2023 World Hepatitis Day.

Hepatitis Queensland is a community based, non-government organisation that represents the interests of people affected by, or at risk of viral hepatitis. We support the community with holistic, proactive and innovative responses to provide better liver health for all Queenslanders. World Hepatitis Day (WHD) 2022 is an annual awareness day celebrated across the globe and throughout Australia. WHD seeks to raise awareness for those affected by or at risk of viral hepatitis as we work towards the global target of eliminating viral hepatitis by 2030.

This Light Up is organised by: Hepatitis QLD

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate
item.xCal:description:
Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Green to support 2023 World Hepatitis Day.

World Hepatitis Day (WHD) 2022 is an annual awareness day celebrated across the globe and throughout Australia. WHD seeks to raise awareness for those affected by or at risk of viral hepatitis as we work towards the global target of eliminating viral hepatitis by 2030.
This Light Up is organised by: Hepatitis QLD
item.x-trumba:customfield: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup
item.description:
Monday, July 31, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit all colours to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup.

From 20 July to 20 August, Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia will co-host the FIFA Women’s World Cup. This will be the first time that the tournament will be co-hosted across two countries and Brisbane/Meaajin is proud to be one of the nine Host Cities.

As well as hosting matches, a Fan Festival™ in Brisbane/Meaanjin will take place at the South Bank Parklands, offering the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.  

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency
